nodes.bodyText: Strictly speaking, you only need the manage_transform cluster privilege, which is included in the built-in transform_admin role. Maybe it would better to only include  manage_transform in the bulleted list, and then follow with the sentence 'The built-in transform_admin role has this privilege'. as before? Same applies to the other pages below.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -19,10 +19,15 @@ Deletes an existing {transform}.
 ==== {api-prereq-title}
 
 * Before you can delete the {transform}, you must stop it.
-* If the {es} {security-features} are enabled, you must have `manage_transform` 
-cluster privileges to use this API. The built-in `transform_admin` role has 
-these privileges. For more information, see <<security-privileges>> and 
-<<built-in-roles>>.
+
+If the {es} {security-features} are enabled, you must have the following

nodes.bodyText: This was monitor_transform and transform_user. Did you mean to change it to manage_transform and transform_admin?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -28,10 +28,14 @@ Retrieves usage information for {transforms}.
 [[get-transform-stats-prereqs]]
 ==== {api-prereq-title}
 
-* If the {es} {security-features} are enabled, you must have `monitor_transform` 
-cluster privileges to use this API. The built-in `transform_user` role has these 
-privileges. For more information, see <<security-privileges>> and 
-<<built-in-roles>>.
+If the {es} {security-features} are enabled, you must have the following 
+privileges:
+
+* `manage_transform`

nodes.bodyText: No, it wasn't intentional. Thanks for spotting it!
